result.query:
Please find the name of the catalyst and co-catalyst name from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
Please only generate the name of the catalyst and nothing else. Such as TiO2. ZrO2 or Ag, etc.
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.
If there are multiple results, please indicate them as XXX-XXX.
catalyst: XXX
co_catalyst: XXX

evidence.pdf_reference: of photocatalyst, naphthol, deionized water and alcohol was dip-coated on FTO glasses, which was as the work electrode.The photocatalytic activity was evaluated by photocatalytic reduction of CO2 with a gas-closed circulation system at a certain temperature and negative atmospheric pressure.The schematic diagram of experimental apparatus is presented in Fig. S1. Photocatalyst (20 mg), 1 mL of triethanolamine (TEOA) and 20 mL H2O were added into a gas-closed glass reactor (80 mL in capacity).Then, the high

electrode was irradiated by a 300 W Xe lamp with a 420 nm cut-off filter.The electron spin resonance (ESR) spectra were measured on a Bruker EMX-1012-type spectrometer with 5, 5-dimethyl-l-pyrroline N-oxide (DMPO) as spin-trapping reagent.The measurements of electrochemical impedance spectroscopy and photocurrents were implemented in a CHI760 electrochemical analyzer with a standard three-electrode system and 0.5 molL -1 Na2SO4 as electrolyte solution.The mixed solution of photocatalyst, naphthol,

(EDS) were performed to investigate the morphology and elemental composition of the as-prepared photocatalys.Ultraviolet-visible diff use reflectance spectra (DRS) were examined on a Shimadzu UV-2600 spectrometer. Photoluminescence (PL) spectra (Labram Model HR800-type spectrophotometer) were conducted to investigate the transfer of photogenerated carriers.Photocurrent measurements were carried out using an electrochemical system (CHI-760B, Chenhua, China), wherein the working electrode was irradiated by a

GN-5.0BFWcomposite (48 h) still exhibited uniform and integrated morphology without g-C3N4 falling off.Generally, different reaction products could be obtained by choosing different catalysts, changing the structural features of the catalysts as well as the reaction conditions. 16No CH4 was found in the present experimental system, manifesting no stacking the photogenerated electrons.Electrochemical reactions involved in CO2 reduction with water are listed as follow 17 : CO2 H2O 2e -CO 2OH - CO2 6H2O

mL in capacity).Then, the high purity CO2 gas was evacuated and refilled for three times to remove the air inside before the lamp turn on. Please find the category of Light_source and Lamp from the provided context which describe an solar chemical experiment.
The generation condition of the extraction is given: If Light_source is Solar or Solar Simulator, Lamp is always Solar Simulator.
Please only select the generation from the provided possible choices.
Possible Choices:
Light_source: ['UV', 'Solar', 'UV-Vis', 'Monochromatic', 'Solar Simulator']
Lamp: ['Fluorescent', 'Mercury', 'Halogen', 'Mercury-Xenon', 'LED', 'Tungsten', 'Xenon', 'Tungsten-Halide', 'Solar Simulator']
Please generating restrictively follow the format, and must start the generation as the format. Do not generate anything else.

Lamp: XXX

Finally, the reactor was filled with CO2 at a pressure of 0.8 atm.A 300 W Xe arc lamp (Aulight CEL-HXF300, Beijing) was used as the light source, which was placed at the top of the optical window (about 10 cm, Light intensity I 70 mW cm 2 .).During the photocatalytic process, the reaction system was vigorously stirred by a magnetic stirrer, and the temperature of the

and the temperature of the reaction system was controlled at 10 C by cooling water circulation.The produced gas was detected and quantified by a gas chromatography (Hope GC 9860) with both TCD and FID detectors.

product was injected into a gas chromatography at given intervals (1 h).Furthermore, the quantitative calculation was according to the external standard method.Only CO could be observed in the reaction system.Among the samples, the pure BFW and g-C3N4 exhibited the moderate activity for CO2 photoreduction with a CO generation rate of 5.2 mol h -1 g -1 and 8.9 mol h -1 g -1 , respectively.After in-situ growing procedure, the obtained GN-xBFW heterostructure samples exhibited substantially enhanced CO2
